formalpara.title: Compact C++ exception handling tables
formalpara.para: GCC now defaults to emitting a compact encoding of C++ exception handling tables, rather than using a DWARF-based scheme. For more information, refer to the documentation of the -mcompact-eh and -mno-compact-eh options in the GCC manual.

formalpara.title: Incorrect accesses to volatile memory
formalpara.para: The compiler no longer generates SWP, LWP, SWM or LWM instructions to access objects declared with the volatile type qualifier, as these instructions can cause multiple memory accesses of unspecified ordering.

formalpara.title: Nondeterministic code generation bug fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused nondeterministic code generation for some input files when optimizing.

formalpara.title: Fix for internal compiler error
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused an internal compiler error when using pointer casts in C++0x constexpr initialization expressions.

formalpara.title: Fix for internal compiler error
formalpara.para: A bug that caused GCC to report an internal compiler error in push_minipool_fix has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Improvement of backtrace on &csl_target_name;
formalpara.para: This release of &csl_prod; includes improved backtrace capabilities on &csl_target_name;. More accurate frame unwinding information is generated by the C compiler by default, improving quality of backtracing. This may slightly increase the size of generated object files and binaries. You can apply the -fno-unwind-tables compiler option to avoid this if desired.

formalpara.title: Compiler crash fixed
formalpara.para: A GCC bug that caused an internal compiler error when emitting some constants has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Fix for bit-field optimization bug
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused incorrect code to be generated for programs using bit-fields has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused an internal compiler error when sign extending the result of an array subscript expression with an index greater than 255.

formalpara.title: GCC version 4.6.3
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; is now based on GCC version 4.6.3. For more information about issues that have been fixed since version 4.6.1, see http://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.6/changes.html.

formalpara.title: New ARMv7-M multilib
formalpara.para: A new multilib that is compatible with the ARMv7-M architecture has been added. For more information, refer to .

formalpara.title: Compiler fix for section conflict error
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that sometimes caused compilation to fail with a section type conflict error when using the -mrelocatable option.

formalpara.title: Fix for compiler hang
formalpara.para: A bug that caused GCC to become stuck in an infinite loop in the optimizer has been fixed.

formalpara.title: ARM miscompilation fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused miscompilation of some expressions involving the minimum or maximum idiom, such as (a > 0) ? a : 0.

formalpara.title: Invalid instruction bug fix
formalpara.para: A GCC bug has been fixed that caused the lwsync instruction to be used on processors that do not support it in the expansions of atomic memory access builtins such as __sync_fetch_and_add.

formalpara.title: Loop optimization bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused some loops over all values of an 8-bit or 16-bit type to run for too many iterations.

formalpara.title: Additional library required on link command line
formalpara.para: Due to internal changes in GCC's support library configuration, you must now include -lgcc_eh on the link command line for SymbianOS applications to avoid undefined symbol errors for exception handling support functions.

formalpara.title: GCC stack usage improvement
formalpara.para: GCC now generates better code for stack allocation in some cases when compiling with -fno-strict-aliasing.

formalpara.title: Support for the MCF51JG ColdFire+ processor
formalpara.para:
&csl_sgxx; now supports the Freescale MCF51JG family of ColdFire+ microcontrollers. Use the -mcpu=51jg option to generate code for these devices.
CS3 board support for MCF51JG64, MCF51JG128 and MCF51JG256 microcontrollers has also been added.

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error with NEON intrinsics
formalpara.para: A compiler bug has been fixed that caused internal compiler errors when using certain NEON intrinsics.

formalpara.title: ARM VFP9-S errata workaround
formalpara.para: A compiler workaround for ARM Errata Notice GENC-010704 (760019: Canceled FDIV or FSQRT can be executed twice) has been implemented.

formalpara.title: Support for MCF51JF and MCF51QM ColdFire+ processors
formalpara.para:
&csl_sgxx; now supports the Freescale MCF51JF and MCF51QM families of ColdFire+ microcontrollers. Use the -mcpu=51jf and -mcpu=51qm options to generate code for these devices.
CS3 board support for MCF51JF32, MCF51JF64, MCF51JF128, MCF51QM32, MCF51QM64 and MCF51QM128 microcontrollers has also been added.

formalpara.title: ColdFire comparison fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused floating-point comparisons with zero to be miscompiled in some circumstances has been fixed. This only affected code using the hardware floating-point unit, not soft-float code.

formalpara.title: MIPS16 branch bug fix
formalpara.para: A compiler bug that caused incorrect code to be generated for MIPS16 branches with offsets greater than 65534 or less than -65536 has been fixed.

formalpara.title: Map file name demangling bug fix
formalpara.para: GCC now properly passes the --demangle and --no-demangle options to the linker to control map file output. The default behavior on all hosts is now to demangle C++ names.

formalpara.title: GCC version 4.6
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; is now based on GCC version 4.6. For more information about changes from GCC version 4.5 that was included in previous releases, see http://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.6/changes.html.
